etymology.description: 爪(爪) (zhǎo, 'hand') + 凡(凡) (fán, 'plate') + 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') -> hand over (凡 corrupted to 舟 (舟) (zhōu, 'boat') for phonetic value -> semantic: 爪 + phonetic: 舟 in seal script
etymology.interpretation: The character 受(受) (shòu, 'receive') originally depicts two hands passing over a plate, representing the action of handing something over. The middle component 凡(凡) (fán, 'plate') evolved into 舟(舟) (zhōu, 'boat') for phonetic reasons. In later scripts, 舟 was simplified to 冖 for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 他受到了表扬(他受到了表揚)。
他不愿受人摆布(他不願受人擺佈)，坚持自己的原则(堅持自己的原則)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù yuàn shòu rén bǎibù, jiānchí zìjǐ de yuánzé.
examples.english: He refuses to be manipulated by others and upholds his own principles.

examples.chinese: 她受到了朋友的关心(她受到了朋友的關心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shòudào le péngyǒu de guānxīn.
examples.english: She received care from her friends.
